meanings.definition: To shed or peel off in scales or layers.
meanings.sent1: After a sunburn, my skin will desquamate to reveal new skin underneath.
meanings.sent2: Snakes desquamate their skin as they grow.
meanings.sent3: I hope my old skin will desquamate and make room for a shiny new layer!
meanings.sent4: The paint on the old house began to desquamate, exposing the weathered wood beneath.
meanings.sent5: The autumn leaves desquamate from the trees, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.

meanings.definition: To exfoliate or slough off skin cells.
meanings.sent1: Using a gentle scrub helps to desquamate dead skin cells and reveal smoother skin.
meanings.sent2: Regular exfoliation can help the skin desquamate naturally.
meanings.sent3: I like to imagine tiny workers inside my skin, helping to desquamate the old cells.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to desquamate the worries from his mind, leaving him feeling lighter.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall's constant flow seemed to desquamate the rocks, smoothing them over time.
